ArticleNumber.description: Alphanumeric character sequence identifying a manufactured, non-configurable product.

CountryOfOrigin.description: Country in which the product is manufactured.

DayOfConstruction.description: The optional DayOfConstrucition provides the day of the month in which the manufacturing process of the machine has been completed. It shall be a number and never change during the life-cycle of a machine.

FabricationNumber.description: Alphanumeric character sequence assigned to a fabricated product, which allows the date, time and circumstances of fabrication to be traced.

GTINCode.description: Bar code number that identifies the device based on the Global Trade Item Number system.

NationalStockNumber.description: 13-digit numeric code, identifying all 'standardized material items of supply' as recognized by the United States Department of Defense.

OrderProductCode.description: Unique combination of numbers and letters used to order the device.

Street.description: Street name where the manufacturer is located.

Number.description: Street number where the manufacturer is located.

City.description: City where the manufacturer is located.

PostalCode.description: Postal code where the manufacturer is located.

State.description: State where the manufacturer is located.

Country.description: Country where the manufacturer is located.

Supplier.description: Name of the supplier or vendor of a device.

TypeOfProduct.description: Characterization of the device based on its usage, operation principle, and its fabricated form.

OnOffCycle.description: This property contains the total number of transitions of the value from the Off to the On state.

Status.description: This property contains the actual status of the element.

DiscreteOutputValue.description: This property contains the actual value of the discrete output unit.

FaultAction.description: This property determines the action taken on variables in fault state.

data.description: This property contains the actual value of the discrete output unit.

PumpKickModeEnum.description: describes the pump kick mode of the pump

PumpKickMode.title: PumpKickModeEnum
PumpKickMode.description: This property describes the pump kick mode of the pump.

PumpKickTime.description: This property determines the absolute time of a pump kick, if Pump Kick Mode is operator specific. The time for the next pump kick results of the sum of Pump Kick Time and Pump Kick Time Difference

PumpKickTimeDifference.description: This property determines the interval time of a pump kick, if Pump Kick Mode is operator specific. The time for the next pump kick results of the sum of Pump Kick Time and Pump Kick Time Difference

PumpKickTimeDifference_EngineeringUnits.description: Unit designator for property and event with name PumpKickTimeDifference, expressed as a URI in the QUDT unit vocabulary

ActualOperationMode.description: This property describes the actual operation mode of the pump.

ControlInversion.description: This property offers the inversion of the selected control mode in operation mode AutoControl. A 'True' status means that the control mode inversion is activated and a 'False' status means that the control mode inversion is deactivated.

Enable.description: This property activates of the control function.

ExternalSignal.description: This property offers the activation of an external electrical interface serving the setpoint of the control function by selecting the kind of electrical (analogue) signal.

ReverseRotatingDirection.description: This property indicates the inversion of the standard rotating direction.

SetControlMode.description: This property describes the desired control mode of the pump.

SetOperationMode.title: OperationModeEnum
SetOperationMode.description: This property describes the desired operation mode of the pump.

CorrectiveMaintenanceTime.description: Part of the maintenance time when active corrective maintenance is carried out on an item, including technical, logistic and internal administrative delays

Criticality.description: Index of the severity of an effect combined with the probability of expected frequency of its occurrence

Failure.description: Termination of the ability of an item to perform a required function. A 'True' status means that the pump has a failure and a 'False' status means that the pump has no failure.

NumberOfFailures.description: Number of failures of an object

Severity.description: Extent of loss, damage or harm caused by a fault or failure

Availability.description: Probability that a machine will, when used under specified conditions, operate satisfactorily and effectively

Durability.description: Actual reliability of an item considering operating modes, operating conditions and possible preventive maintenance actions carried out

ExpectedReliability.description: Reliability of an item determined by design and manufacture under expected conditions of operation and maintenance

InstantaneousAvailability.description: Probability that an item is in a state to perform as required at a given instant, under given conditions, assuming that the necessary external resources are provided

IntrinsicMaintainability.description: Maintainability of an item determined by the design under expected conditions of maintenance and logistic support

IntrinsicReliability.description: Reliability of an item determined by design and manufacture under expected conditions of operation assuming that no preventive maintenance task is carried out, excepting routine maintenance

Maintainability.description: Ability of a machine or part of a system to be retained in, or restored to, a state in which it can perform the required function(s)

OperationalReliability.description: Actual reliability of an item considering operating modes, operating conditions and possible preventive maintenance actions carried out

ProductionBasedAvailability.description: Ratio of actual production to required production, or any other reference level, over a specified period of time

Reliability.description: Probability that a machine will perform its required functions without failure for a specified time period when used under specified conditions

TimeBasedAvailability.description: During a given period of time, percentage of the time during which an item was able to perform when required

DeclarationOfConformityOptionSet.description: defines flags for directives on the basis of which conformity was determined

S2006_42_EC.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2006/ 42/ EG, concerning machinery and amending Directive 95/16/EG

S2009_125_EC.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2009/ 125/ EC, establishing a framework for the setting of ecodesign requirements for energy-related products

S2011_65_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2011/ 65/ EU, restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical and electronic equipment

S2014_35_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2014/ 35/ EU, harmonisation of the laws of the Member States on the provision of electrical equipment for use within certain voltage limits on the market

S2014_34_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2014/ 34/ EU, harmonisation of the laws of the Member States concerning equipment and protective systems intended for use in potentially explosive atmospheres

S2014_30_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2014/ 30/ EU, harmonisation of the laws of the Member States on electromagnetic compatibility

S2014_68_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2014/ 68/ EU, harmonisation of Member States' legislation on the provision of pressure equipment on the market

S2014_29_EU.description: Directives of the EU Declaration of Conformity - 2014/ 29/ EU, harmonisation of the laws of the Member States relating to the making available on the market of simple pressure vessels

ExplosionProtectionOptionSet.description: defines flags for the category of explosion protection for devices according to EU Directive 2014/34/EU (ATEX)

M1.description: This category is intended for use in underground mines and their surface installations which may be endangered by firedamp and/or combustible dust. Category 1 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a very high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

M2.description: This category is intended for use in underground mines and their surface installations which may be endangered by firedamp and/or combustible dust. Category 2 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S1G.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and gases, vapours or mists is present. Category 1 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a very high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S2G.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and gases, vapours or mists is present. Category 2 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S3G.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and gases, vapours or mists is present. Category 3 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a normal level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S1D.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and dust is present. Category 1 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a very high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S2D.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and dust is present. Category 2 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a high level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

S3D.description: Devices in this category are intended for use in areas in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture of air and dust is present. Category 3 comprises devices designed to be capable of functioning in conformity with the parameters specified by the manufacturer and ensuring a normal level of safety. (2014/34/EU)

OfferedControlModesOptionSet.description: defines flags for offerd control modes supported by the manufacturer for the product

OfferedFieldbusesOptionSet.description: defines flags for fieldbuses supported by the manufacturer for the product

Other.description: Additional fieldbuses listed in the AdditionalFieldbuses variable

AdditionalFieldbuses.description: Additional fieldbuses supported by the product.

BalancingRateOfFlow.description: Rate of flow which is extracted to activate a balance device

BasePressure.description: Pressure obtained in the test dome after conditioning the vacuum pump and the test dome

ClearanceVolume.description: Volume remaining unswept at the end of the discharge stroke.

ClockwiseRotation.description: Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in a clockwise direction when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise.

Controllable.description: Indicates whether the product is a controllable pump or a self-controlling pump. A 'True' status means that the pump is controllable and a 'False' status means that the pump is not controllable.

Cool_DownTimeForAVaporJetPumpOrADiffusio.description: The cool-down time is the time required to cool the propellant from the working temperature to a temperature at which the propellant can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk after the heating has been switched off.

Counter_ClockwiseRotation.description: Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in an anticlockwise direction, when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise.

CriticalSpeed.description: Speed of rotation at which the frequency of vibration (or its multiples) corresponds to the rotor resonant (lateral or torsional)

DeclarationOfConformity.description: Publicly accessible attestation of conformity, commonly available on websites.

DeclarationOfConformityAvailable.description: Whether or not a declaration of conformity exists. A 'True' status means that the declaration exists and a 'False' status means that there is no declaration available.

DesignAxialLoad.description: Residual axial thrust on the pump rotor on which the thrust-bearing selection is based.

DesignRadialLoad.description: Radial load of the pump rotor for which the bearing system is selected.

DirectivesOfEUDeclarationOfConformity.title: DeclarationOfConformityOptionSet
DirectivesOfEUDeclarationOfConformity.description: Set of directives on the basis of which conformity was determined.

DryCriticalSpeed.description: Rotor resonant frequency calculated assuming that the rotor is supported only at its bearings and that the bearings are of infinite stiffness

ExplosionProtection.title: ExplosionProtectionOptionSet
ExplosionProtection.description: Device category for explosion protection according to 2014/34/EU (ATEX).

GeometricalFlow.description: Product of geometrical displacement volume and speed of rotation or stroke frequency

GeometricDisplacementVolume.description: Displacement volume for one stroke or one cycle.

HeadAtPeakPoint.description: Highest total head developed by a pump when this does not occur at a zero rate of flow

LeakageRateOfFlow.description: Rate of flow leaking from shaft seals

MaximumAllowableAmbientTemperature.description: Highest allowable ambient temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

MaximumAllowableCasingWorkingPressure.description: Greatest outlet pressure at the specified operating temperature at which the pump casing can be used

MaximumAllowableContinuousSpeed.description: Highest rotational speed for continuous operation recommended by the manufacturer

MaximumAllowableHead.description: Maximum permissible head at which the pump can be continuously operated without suffering damage

MaximumAllowableRelativeHumidity.description: Highest allowable relative humidity for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

MaximumAllowableTemperature.description: Highest allowable continuous fluid temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable when handling the specified operating fluid at the specified operating pressure

MaximumAllowableThroughput.description: Maximum pV flow the pump can withstand without damage

MaximumAllowableWorkingPressure.description: Pressure for a component on the basis of materials used and on the basis of calculation rules at the specified operating temperature

MaximumAxialLoad.description: Greatest value of the residual axial thrust on the pump rotor resulting from operating the pump at any condition within its allowable operating range.

MaximumPumpPowerInput.description: Highest value of the pump power input at any rate of flow at any allowable operating condition

MaximumRadialLoad.description: Greatest radial load of the pump rotor resulting from operating the pump at any condition within its allowable operating range.

MaximumStaticSealingPressure.description: Highest pressure, excluding hydrostatic testing, to which the seal can be subjected while the pump is shut down

MeanTimebetweenFailures.description: Average of the times between failures.

MinimumAllowableAmbientTemperature.description: Lowest allowable ambient temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

MinimumAllowableContinuousSpeed.description: Lowest speed for continuous operation recommended by the manufacturer

MinimumAllowableHead.description: Minimum permissible head at which the pump can be operated without suffering damage

MinimumAllowableRelativeHumidity.description: Lowest allowable relative humidity for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable

MinimumAllowableTemperature.description: Lowest allowable continuous temperature for which the equipment (or any part to which the term refers) is suitable when handling the specified operating fluid at the specified operating pressure

MinimumAllowableThermalFlow.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can operate without its operation being impaired by the temperature rise of the pumped liquid

MinimumContinuousStableFlow.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can be operated without it adversely affecting its performance in terms of life expectancy, noise and vibrations

MinimumContinuousThermalFlow.description: Lowest flow at which the pump can operate without its operation being impaired by the temperature rise of the pumped liquid

NetPositiveSuctionHeadRequired.description: Minimum NPSH at the pump inlet connection required to give the rated or operating performance at the specified conditions

NetPositiveSuctionHeadRequiredForADropOf.description: NPSH required for a drop of 3 % in the total head of the first stage of the pump as a standard basis for use in performance curves

OfferedControlModes.title: OfferedControlModesOptionSet
OfferedControlModes.description: Control modes supported by the manufacturer for the product.

OfferedFieldbuses.title: OfferedFieldbusesOptionSet
OfferedFieldbuses.description: Fieldbuses supported by the manufacturer for the product.

OptimumHead.description: Total head developed by the pump at a rate of flow corresponding to the best efficiency

OptimumPumpPowerInput.description: Pump power input at the rate of flow corresponding to the best efficiency

OptimumRateOfFlow.description: Rate of flow at the point of best efficiency

PistonVelocity.description: Average speed given by the stroke length multiplied with the number of complete pumping cycles of the piston, plunger or piston attached to the diaphragm per minute (stroke per minute or pump crank speed)

PossibleFluids.description: Fluids that can be pumped by the pump.

Pre_ChargePressure.description: Pressure to which the pulsation dampener is charged with dry gas prior to start of operation

PumpClass.title: DeviceTypeEnum
PumpClass.description: Pump type according to functional principle and pumped fluid

Shut_OffHead.description: Total head developed by the pump in a zero rate of flow

Shut_OffPumpPowerInput.description: Pump power input at zero rate of flow

SoundEnergy.description: Integral of the sound power, P, over a stated time interval of duration T (starting at t1 and ending at t2).

SoundEnergyLevel.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound energy, J, to a reference value, J0, expressed in decibels.

SoundPower.description: Through a surface, product of the sound pressure, p, and the component of the particle velocity, un, at a point on the surface in the direction normal to the surface, integrated over that surface.

SoundPowerLevel.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound power of a source, P, to a reference value, P0, expressed in decibels.

SoundPressure.description: Difference between instantaneous pressure and static pressure.

SoundPressureLevel.description: Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the square of the sound pressure, p, to the square of a reference value, p0, expressed in decibels.

SpecificSpeed.description: Speed that characterizes a pump in terms of its speed, flow rate per impeller eye, i.e. total flow for single-flow impeller, half flow for double-flow impeller, at the best efficiency point and head per stage at maximum impeller diameter

StandardGasFlowrate.description: Volume flow rate at standard reference conditions, i.e. 0 C and 101 325 Pa

StartingPressure.description: The starting pressure is the pressure at which a vacuum pump can be switched on and a pumping effect is achieved without damage occurring.

Suction_SpecificSpeed.description: Speed that characterizes a pump's cavitation performance in terms of its speed, optimum rate of flow per impeller eye at best efficiency point and NPSH3 at best efficiency point for the first stage at maximum impeller diameter

SweptVolume.description: Volume traversed by a single stroke of piston, plunger or diaphragm.

TripSpeed.description: Speed at which the independent emergency overspeed devices operate to shut down a prime mover

TypeNumber.description: Pure number calculated at the point of best efficiency

VolumeFlowRate.description: Volume flow rate of the gas removed by the pump from the gas phase within the evacuated chamber.

VolumeFlowRateOfBackingPump.description: Maximum volume flow rate for which the conditions are defined in the instruction manual or in a specific standard for the particular vacuum pump

WarmUpTimeForAVaporJetPumpOrADiffusionPu.description: The warm-up time is the time required to heat the blowing agent in the boiling vessel to its working temperature. The initial temperature can either be equal to the ambient temperature or equal to the temperature at which the blowing agent of the vacuum pump can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk.

WaterVaporTolerableLoad.description: The mass flow rate for water vapor, in a gas ballast pump, in continuous operation and under normal ambient conditions, if the pumped gas is pure water vapor.

WetCriticalSpeed.description: Rotor resonant frequency calculated considering the additional support and damping produced by the action of the pumped fluid within rotor

data.description: Additional fieldbuses supported by the product.
Rate of flow which is extracted to activate a balance device
Pressure obtained in the test dome after conditioning the vacuum pump and the test dome
Volume remaining unswept at the end of the discharge stroke.

Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in a clockwise direction when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise.
Indicates whether the product is a controllable pump or a self-controlling pump. A 'True' status means that the pump is controllable and a 'False' status means that the pump is not controllable.

The cool-down time is the time required to cool the propellant from the working temperature to a temperature at which the propellant can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk after the heating has been switched off.

Direction of rotation in which the shaft is seen to be turning in an anticlockwise direction, when viewing the drive end of the shaft. A 'True' status means that the rotation of pump is anticlockwise and a 'False' status means that the rotation of pump is clockwise.
Speed of rotation at which the frequency of vibration (or its multiples) corresponds to the rotor resonant (lateral or torsional)
Publicly accessible attestation of conformity, commonly available on websites.
Whether or not a declaration of conformity exists. A 'True' status means that the declaration exists and a 'False' status means that there is no declaration available.
Residual axial thrust on the pump rotor on which the thrust-bearing selection is based.
Radial load of the pump rotor for which the bearing system is selected.

data.description: Set of directives on the basis of which conformity was determined.
Rotor resonant frequency calculated assuming that the rotor is supported only at its bearings and that the bearings are of infinite stiffness

data.description: Pump type according to functional principle and pumped fluid
Total head developed by the pump in a zero rate of flow
Pump power input at zero rate of flow
Flow lost internally through clearances
Integral of the sound power, P, over a stated time interval of duration T (starting at t1 and ending at t2).
Ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound energy, J, to a reference value, J0, expressed in decibels.
Through a surface, product of the sound pressure, p, and the component of the particle velocity, un, at a point on the surface in the direction normal to the surface, integrated over that surface.

Speed that characterizes a pump in terms of its speed, flow rate per impeller eye, i.e. total flow for single-flow impeller, half flow for double-flow impeller, at the best efficiency point and head per stage at maximum impeller diameter
Volume flow rate at standard reference conditions, i.e. 0 C and 101 325 Pa
The starting pressure is the pressure at which a vacuum pump can be switched on and a pumping effect is achieved without damage occurring.

Speed that characterizes a pump's cavitation performance in terms of its speed, optimum rate of flow per impeller eye at best efficiency point and NPSH3 at best efficiency point for the first stage at maximum impeller diameter
Volume traversed by a single stroke of piston, plunger or diaphragm.

Pure number calculated at the point of best efficiency

The warm-up time is the time required to heat the blowing agent in the boiling vessel to its working temperature. The initial temperature can either be equal to the ambient temperature or equal to the temperature at which the blowing agent of the vacuum pump can be exposed to atmospheric air without risk.
The mass flow rate for water vapor, in a gas ballast pump, in continuous operation and under normal ambient conditions, if the pumped gas is pure water vapor.
Rotor resonant frequency calculated considering the additional support and damping produced by the action of the pumped fluid within rotor

AtmosphericPressure.description: Mean absolute pressure of the atmosphere measured at the place of installation (2.1.1.3) of the pump

Density.description: Volumetric mass at a stated temperature

DynamicViscosity.description: Ratio of the shear stress to the shear velocity acting in a liquid subjected to a plane shear motion

ExplosionZoneOptionSet.description: defines flags for the category of explosion zones for devices

Zone_0.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture with air of flammable substances in the form of gas, vapour or mist is present continuously or for long periods or frequently.

Zone_1.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture with air of flammable substances in the form of gas, vapour or mist is likely to occur in normal operation occasionally.

Zone_2.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere consisting of a mixture with air of flammable substances in the form of gas, vapour or mist is not likely to occur in normal operation but, if it does occur, will persist for a short period only.

Zone_20.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere in the form of a cloud of combustible dust in air is present continuously, for long periods or frequently.

Zone_21.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere in the form of a cloud of combustible dust in air is likely to occur in normal operation occasionally.

Zone_22.description: A zone in which an explosive atmosphere in the form of a cloud of combustible dust in air is not likely to occur in normal operation but, if it does occur, will persist for a short period only.

Other.description: Fieldbus is not specified in this enumeration

MaximumOutletPressure.description: Maximum possible pressure at outlet, due either to internal energy increase (rotodynamic pumps) or external downstream restrictions (volumetric pumps)

MaximumRelativeHumidity.description: Highest relative humidity that can be expected under normal circumstances.

MaximumTemperature.description: Highest fluid temperature to be expected under operating conditions

MeanTimeBetweenFailures.description: Average of the times between failures

MinimumAmbientTemperature.description: Lowest ambient temperature to be expected under normal circumstances

MinimumOutletPressure.description: Lowest outlet pressure that can occur during operation for the pump

MinimumTemperature.description: Lowest fluid temperature to be expected under operating conditions

Multi_Phase.description: Comprising a fluid together with substances in solid or gaseous states, whether due to deliberate addition or a change of state caused by a change in conditions. A 'True' status means that there is a possibility of multi-phase-fluid and a 'False' status means that there is no possibility of multi-phase-fluid.

NetPositiveInletPressureAvailable.description: Total pressure (including velocity pressure) at the pump inlet connection less the liquid vapor pressure at the present temperature of the liquid

NormalFlow.description: Rate of flow at which usual operation is expected

NpshDatumPlane.description: Horizontal plane through the center of the circle described by the external points of the entrance edges of the impeller blades, in the first stage in the case of multi-stage pumps

Throughput.description: Amount of fluid flowing through a duct

UltimatePressureOfAVacuumPump.description: The ultimate pressure is the value to which the pressure in a standardized test dome approaches asymptotically during normal operation of the vacuum pump and without gas inlet. A difference can be made between the final pressure caused by gases and the final pressure caused by gases and vapors.

CommandVariable.description: Variable quantity, which is not influenced by the control but is introduced into the control system from outside with the aim of making the final controlled variable follow it in a given relationship

ControlDifferenceVariable.description: Difference between the reference variable and the feedback variable

ControlledVariable.description: Output variable of the controlled system that will be acted upon by one or more manipulated variables

ControllerOutputVariable.description: Output variable of the controlling element, which is deducted from the control difference variable and is also the input variable of the actuator

DeadTime.description: In a dead-time element the duration of the time interval by which the output variable is shifted relative to the input variable

DerivativeActionCoefficient.description: For a derivative element, the quotient of the value of the output variable to the value of the time derivative of the input variable

FeedbackVariable.description: Variable quantity, which represents the controlled variable and is returned to the comparing element

FinalControlledVariable.description: Variable quantity which has, or combination of variable quantities which have, to be influenced by the control

IntegralActionCoefficient.description: For an integral element, the quotient of the time derivative of the output variable to the fixed value of the input variable

ManipulatedVariable.description: Output variable of the controlling system, which is also an input variable of the controlled system

OperatingMode.description: Characterization of the way and the extent to which the human operator intervenes in the control equipment

ProportionalActionCoefficient.description: For a proportional element, the quotient of the variation of the output variable to the corresponding variation of the input variable

ReferenceVariable.description: Input variable to a comparing element in a controlling system, which sets the desired value of the controlled variable and is deducted from the command variable

DeadTime_EngineeringUnits.description: Unit designator for property and event with name DeadTime, expressed as a URI in the QUDT unit vocabulary

MaintenanceLevelEnum.description: defines maintenance levels for the pump

Level1.description: Level 1 is characterized by simple actions carried out with minimal training

Level2.description: Level 2 is characterized by basic actions which have to be carried out by qualified personnel using detailed procedures

Level3.description: Level 3 is characterized by complex actions carried out by qualified technical personnel using detailed procedures

Level4.description: Level 4 is characterized by actions which imply the know-how of a technique or a technology and carried out by specialized technical personnel

Level5.description: Level 5 is characterized by actions which imply a knowledge held by the manufacturer or a specialized company with industrial logistic support equipment

StateOfTheItemEnum.description: describes the state of the pump

IdleState.description: Item is in up state and non-operating outside required time

StandByState.description: Item is in up state and non-operating during required time

OperatingState.description: Item is in up state and operating as required

ExternalDisabledState.description: Item is in up state, but lacks required external resources or is disabled due to planned actions other than maintenance

DownState.description: Item is unable to perform a required function due to preventive maintenance or a fault

ActiveMaintenanceTime.description: Part of the maintenance time when active maintenance is carried out on an item.

DownTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in a down state

ExternalDisabledTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in an external disabled state

FailureRate.description: Number of failures within a population divided by the number of life units used by that population

IdleTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in an idle state

MaintenanceTime.description: Time interval when maintenance is carried out on an item including technical, logistic and internal administrative delays

MeanOperatingTimeBetweenFailures.description: Average of the operating times between failures

MeanTimeToRestauration.description: Average of the time to restauration

Obsolescence.description: Inability of an item to be maintained due to the unavailability on the market of the necessary resources at acceptable technical and/or economic conditions. A 'True' status means that the pump is obsolete and a 'False' status means that the pump is not obsolete.

OperatingTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in operating state

OperatingTimeToFailure.description: Operating time accumulated from the first use, or from restoration, until failure

RepairTime.description: Part of corrective maintenance time when repair is carried out on an item.

StandbyTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in a standby state

TimeToRestoration.description: Time interval, from the instant of failure, until restoration

UpTime.description: Measured time interval throughout which an item is in an up state

data.description: Pressure at the inlet of the pump, measured at a defined location in the test dome.

ArticleNumber.description: Alphanumeric character sequence identifying a manufactured, non-configurable product.

CountryOfOrigin.description: Country in which the product is manufactured.

DayOfConstruction.description: The optional DayOfConstrucition provides the day of the month in which the manufacturing process of the machine has been completed. It shall be a number and never change during the life-cycle of a machine.

DeviceClass.description: Domain or for what purpose this item is used.

FabricationNumber.description: Alphanumeric character sequence assigned to a fabricated product, which allows the date, time and circumstances of fabrication to be traced.

GTINCode.description: Bar code number that identifies the device based on the Global Trade Item Number system.

NationalStockNumber.description: 13-digit numeric code, identifying all 'standardized material items of supply' as recognized by the United States Department of Defense.

OrderProductCode.description: Unique combination of numbers and letters used to order the device.

Street.description: Street name where the manufacturer is located.

Number.description: Street number where the manufacturer is located.

City.description: City where the manufacturer is located.

PostalCode.description: Postal code where the manufacturer is located.

State.description: State where the manufacturer is located.

Country.description: Country where the manufacturer is located.

Supplier.description: Name of the supplier or vendor of a device.

TypeOfProduct.description: Characterisation of the device based on its usage, operation principle, and its fabricated form.

ActivePreventiveMaintenanceTime.description: This attribute indicates the date of installation or commissioning of the device.

InstallationDate.description: This attribute identifies the date when the device was last inspected.

LastInspectionDate.description: This attribute identifies the date when the device is scheduled for the next inspection.

LastServicingDate.description: This attribute identifies the date when the device is scheduled for the next servicing.

NextInspectionDate.description: This attribute identifies the date when the device was last serviced.

NextServicingDate.description: Part of maintenance time when preventive maintenance is carried out on an item, including technical, logistic and internal administrative delays

PreventiveMaintenanceTime.description: Part of the active maintenance time taken to perform a preventive maintenance

AxialLoadOfPumpRotor.description: Measured residual thrust acting through the shaft derived from hydraulic or mechanical forces

AxialRotorPosition.description: Measured position of the axial rotor in bearing.

BackPressure.description: Measured back pressure of the pump

ClearanceFlow.description: Measured clearance flow between the housing and the impeller

DifferentialPressure.description: Determined (actual) gain in total pressure between the pump inlet and pump outlet

DynamicViscosity.description: Measured kinematic viscosity of the fluid

FluidTemperature.description: Measured internal temperature of pump fluid.

HydraulicEfficiency.description: Determined proportion of pump available power input, Pa, which is delivered as pump power output, Pu, after satisfying the losses resulting from friction due to the relative motion of internal surfaces and internal leakage

InletPressureOfTheInstallation.description: Measured pressure at the inlet area of the installation.

InstallationTotalHead.description: Determined difference between the total head at the outlet side of the installation and the total head at the inlet side of the installation

KinematicViscosity.description: Measured dynamic viscosity of the fluid

LeakageRateOfFlow.description: Measured rate of flow leaking from shaft seals

LubricatingOilConsumption.description: Measured oil consumption of the lubricating system

LubricatingOilPressure.description: Measured oil pressure of the lubrication system

MassFlow.description: Measure mass flow from the outlet area of the pump

MeanVelocityAtThroat.description: Measured rate of flow passing through the exit from the volute divided by the throat area

MechanicalEfficiency.description: Determined proportion of the pump power input, P, available after satisfying the mechanical power losses, PJ, ab, at given operating conditions

NetPositiveInletPressure.description: Total pressure (including velocity pressure) at the pump inlet connection less the liquid vapor pressure at the present temperature of the liquid

NetPositiveSuctionHead.description: Amount of the absolute value of the total head above the head, equivalent to the vapor pressure of the liquid at the particular temperature, with reference to the NPSH datum plane

OutletPressureOfTheInstallation.description: Measured pressure at the outlet area of the installation.

OverallEfficiency.description: Determined proportion of the driver power input, Pmot, delivered as pump power output, Pu

PowerLossDueToInternalLeakage.description: Determined power loss due clearance flows

ProcessPressure.description: Measured process pressure of the pump

PumpEfficiency.description: Determined proportion of the pump power input, P, delivered as pump power output, Pu, at given operating conditions

PumpPowerInput.description: Measured power transmitted to the pump by its driver

PumpPowerOutput.description: Measured useful mechanical power transferred to the fluid during its passage through the pump

PumpTotalHead.description: Determined difference between the total head at the outlet side of the pump and the total head at the inlet side of the pump

RadialLoadOfPumpRotor.description: Measured residual force acting at right angles to the line of the shaft and derived from hydraulic forces

SoundEnergy.description: Determined integral of the sound power, P, over a stated time interval of duration T (starting at t1 and ending at t2)

SoundEnergyLevel.description: Determined ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound energy, J, to a reference value, J0, expressed in decibels

SoundPower.description: Determined through a surface, product of the sound pressure, p, and the component of the particle velocity, un, at a point on the surface in the direction normal to the surface, integrated over that surface

SoundPowerLevel.description: Determined ten times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the sound power of a source, P, to a reference value, P0, expressed in decibels

SoundPressure.description: Measured difference between instantaneous pressure and static pressure

SoundPressureLevel.description: Determined ten times logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the square of the sound pressure, p, to the square of a reference value, p0, expressed in decibels

Speed.description: Measured number of rotations or movements made by the shaft, coupling or impeller in a given time

Throughput.description: Measured throughput of the vacuum pump

TotalHeadAtInletAreaOfTheInstallation.description: Determined total head at the inlet area of the installation, which corresponds to the sum of geodetic head, pressure head and velocity head

TotalHeadAtOutletAreaOfTheInstallation.description: Determined total head at the outlet area of the installation, which corresponds to the sum of geodetic head, pressure head and velocity head

VolumetricEfficiency.description: Determined ratio of the actual delivered volume at maximum pressure to the geometric displacement volume

BearingIndex.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

BearingIndexPerG.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

BroadbandCavitationAccelerationPerG_RMS.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal due to cavitation within a defined frequency range, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The frequency range is regularly defined by the user.

BroadbandCavitationAccelerationRMS.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal due to cavitation within a defined frequency range, expressed as acceleration. The frequency range is regularly defined by the user.

GapVoltage.description: Sum value of the oscillation ranges of the vibration at all frequencies except the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement. Regularly, only the frequency range below the rotational frequency is considered.

Not1XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P.description: Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

OverallVibrationAcceleration0_P.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationAccelerationP_P.description: Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationAccelerationPerG_RMS.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g

OverallVibrationAccelerationPerG0_P.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationAccelerationPerGP_P.description: Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationAccelerationRMS.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration

OverallVibrationDisplacementP_P.description: Oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationDisplacementRMS.description: Root mean square of oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationVelocity0_P.description: Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationVelocityP_P.description: Oscillation range, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

OverallVibrationVelocityRMS.description: Root mean square of the oscillation displacement expressed as velocity

ReferenceStandardForVibrationMeasurement.description: Standard to which statements on vibration measurement refer.

RotationalPhase1X.description: Phase of the vibration amplitude at the rotation frequency (1X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

RotationalPhase2X.description: Phase of the vibration amplitude at the first harmonic of the rotation frequency (2X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

S1XPhase.description: Phase of the 1X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

S1XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P.description: Oscillation range at the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.

S2XPhase.description: Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

S2XRelativeShaftVibrationP_P.description: Oscillation range at the double rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.

ThrustPosition.description: Measure for the distance between the sensor and the shaft, expressed as device output voltage

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheBearingDefectFreq.description: Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheBladePassFrequenc.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft multiplied with the number of blades mounted at the shaft, expressed as velocity.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheFirstHarmonicOfTh.description: Oscillation amplitude at the double rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheGearMeshingFreque.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration.

Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheHarmonicsOfTheRot.description: Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the harmonics of the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheRotationFrequency.description: Oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

VibrationAmplitudeAtTheSidebandsOfTheGea.description: Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration.

Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.

Root mean square of the oscillation signal due to cavitation within a defined frequency range, expressed as acceleration. The frequency range is regularly defined by the user.

Sum value of the oscillation ranges of the vibration at all frequencies except the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement. Regularly, only the frequency range below the rotational frequency is considered.
Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.
Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g

Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.

Oscillation range, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Root mean square of the oscillation displacement, expressed as acceleration
Oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Root mean square of oscillation range, expressed as local displacement. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Maximum oscillation amplitude, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Oscillation range, expressed as velocity. The oscillation range is the difference between the minimum and maximum value within the time range under consideration.
Root mean square of the oscillation displacement expressed as velocity
Standard to which statements on vibration measurement refer.

Phase of the vibration amplitude at the rotation frequency (1X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.

Phase of the vibration amplitude at the first harmonic of the rotation frequency (2X) of the object under consideration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.
Phase of the 1X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.
Oscillation range at the rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.
Phase of the 2X relative shaft vibration related to a reference point of time. The reference point of time for the phase is defined by a so called phase reference sensor.
Oscillation range at the double rotation frequency of the shaft under consideration, expressed as displacement.
Number of revolutions per time.
Measure for the distance between the sensor and the shaft, expressed as device output voltage

Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.

Amplitude of the oscillation envelope at the roller bearing defect frequencies after high pass filtering, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g. The parameter for the high pass filtering and oscillation envelope are regularly defined by the user.
Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft multiplied with the number of blades mounted at the shaft, expressed as velocity.
Oscillation amplitude at the double rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.

Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration.

Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the shaft, multiplied with the number of teeth of the gear mounted at the shaft, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.
Performance indicator of vibration calculated from the oscillation amplitude at the harmonics of the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.
Oscillation amplitude at the rotation frequency of the object under consideration, expressed as velocity.
Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration.

Root mean square of the oscillation signal within defined frequency ranges, which include the side bands of the mesh frequency above and below the mesh frequency, expressed as acceleration in units of the acceleration of gravity g.

ProductInstanceUri.description: A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the machine

InitialOperationDate.description: The date, when the MachineryItem was switched on the first time after it has left the manufacturer plant.

Manufacturer.description: A human-readable, localized name of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

MonthOfConstruction.description: The month in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a number between 1 and 12, representing the month from January to December.

SerialNumber.description: A string containing a unique production number of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem. The global uniqueness of the serial number is only given in the context of the manufacturer, and potentially the model. The value shall not change during the life-cycle of the MachineryItem.

YearOfConstruction.description: The year (Gregorian calendar) in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a four-digit number and never change during the life-cycle of a MachineryItem.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

Location.description: To be used by end users to store the location of the machine in a scheme specific to the end user. Servers shall support at least 60 Unicode characters for the clients writing this value, this means clients can expect to be able to write strings with a length of 60 Unicode characters into that field.

ProductInstanceUri.description: A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the machine

AssetId.description: To be used by end users to store a unique identification in the context of their overall application. Servers shall support at least 40 Unicode characters for the clients writing this value, this means clients can expect to be able to write strings with a length of 40 Unicode characters into that field.

ComponentName.description: To be used by end users to store a human-readable localized text for the MachineryItem. The minimum number of locales supported for this property shall be two. Servers shall support at least 40 Unicode characters for the clients writing the text part of each locale, this means clients can expect to be able to write texts with a length of 40 Unicode characters into that field.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

DeviceClass.description: Indicates in which domain or for what purpose the MachineryItem is used.

HardwareRevision.description: A string representation of the revision level of the hardware of a MachineryItem. Hardware is physical equipment, as opposed to programs, procedures, rules and associated documentation. Many machines will not provide such information due to the modular and configurable nature of the machine.

InitialOperationDate.description: The date, when the MachineryItem was switched on the first time after it has left the manufacturer plant.

Manufacturer.description: A human-readable, localized name of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

ManufacturerUri.description: A globally unique identifier of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

Model.description: A human-readable, localized name of the model of the MachineryItem.

MonthOfConstruction.description: The month in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a number between 1 and 12, representing the month from January to December.

ProductCode.description: A machine-readable string of the model of the MachineryItem, that might include options like the hardware configuration of the model. This information might be provided by the ERP system of the vendor. For example, it can be used as order information.

ProductInstanceUri.description: A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

SerialNumber.description: A string containing a unique production number of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem. The global uniqueness of the serial number is only given in the context of the manufacturer, and potentially the model. The value shall not change during the life-cycle of the MachineryItem.

SoftwareRevision.description: A string representation of the revision level of a MachineryItem. In most cases, MachineryItems consist of several software components. In that case, information about the software components might be provided as additional information in the address space, including individual revision information. In that case, this property is either not provided or provides an overall software revision level. The value might change during the life-cycle of a MachineryItem.

YearOfConstruction.description: The year (Gregorian calendar) in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a four-digit number and never change during the life-cycle of a MachineryItem.
